page.title: 13EMPLOYMENT _ CHIGNALS
page.content: Most of the villages who are of working age commute to London,Chelmsford, or Writtle. A number of people without transport have difficulty in getting to work due to the inadequate public transport.There are also many elderly who live there to be in a quiet community,but still within reach of a large town i.e. Chelmsford. There is very little unemployment in the area due to, the low population. The farms in the area employ a few local workers. The majority of the women remain at home, some involved in voluntary work. The gravel pit employs ten workers (all male), but only a few are local, most commuting from Chelmsford and one from Southend. The only place where unemployment is increasing is Chignal St. James.
